==Dialogue==
{{Stub|1. conditions for dialogue sets<br>2. is there a non-Aranyani version of set #1?}}
===Dialogue Set #1===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Arayasa:''' "Fate weaves the web of the lost, yet {{MC|m=her|f=his}} journey is not deterred a sunrise or moonset."
:{{DIcon}} About Festival Utsava...
::'''Arayasa:''' "Drifting flowers gather in the embrace of Queen Aranyani, about to sing the song of dreams."
:{{DIcon}} About Araji...
::'''Arayasa:''' "The seed that was hidden in the shadow bloomed into starlight that even the high-hanging sun had never seen."
::'''Arayasa:''' Thank you, Nara, for letting Arayasa listen to the song of Araji again.
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #2===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Arayasa:''' "To meet again in the land where trees flourish... Fate cannot catch up to {{MC|m=her|f=his}} footsteps."
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Arayasa:''' "The sky graced with stars far and wide casts bright light. The birds of tireless tweets are a company to your sleep."
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #3===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Arayasa:''' "...Singing your song forever is the pact between you and me."
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* "Arayasa" is derived from {{W|Vyasa}}, traditionally regarded as the author of the Sanskrit epic {{W|Mahabharata}}.
** Other Aranaras involved in ''[[Encounter in the Woods]]'' are also named after poets in ancient India, fitting their roles as song-gatherers.
